visuals: Smooth camera zoom into a vibrant, rotating 3D molecular model of Aspirin (Acetylsalicylic Acid). Highlight key functional groups. Overlay chemical formula (C9H8O4).
narration: Aspirin, or Acetylsalicylic Acid, a common pain reliever.

visuals: Transition to a simplified cellular environment. Show a 3D model of a Cyclooxygenase (COX) enzyme. An Aspirin molecule approaches and irreversibly binds to the active site of the COX enzyme, visually inhibiting its function (e.g., active site conformational change).
narration: It works by inhibiting COX enzymes, reducing inflammation.

visuals: Seamless transition to a new vibrant, rotating 3D molecular model of Hydrocortisone (Cortisol). Highlight steroid rings. Overlay chemical formula (C21H30O5).
narration: Introducing Hydrocortisone, a steroid binding to its Glucocorticoid Receptor.

scene: Drug-Drug Interaction: Plasma Protein Binding & Receptor Activation
visuals: Visualize the bloodstream: a large, intricate 'Albumin' plasma protein with multiple binding sites. Hydrocortisone molecules are initially shown bound to albumin. Aspirin molecules enter the scene, demonstrating a stronger affinity and displacing Hydrocortisone from albumin binding sites. The newly 'free' Hydrocortisone molecules are highlighted. These free Hydrocortisone molecules then diffuse into a cell, approaching and binding to the Glucocorticoid Receptor (NR3C1) inside the cell. Show a conformational change in NR3C1 upon binding, indicating activation and potential nuclear translocation.
narration: Both drugs bind to plasma proteins. Aspirin displaces Hydrocortisone, increasing its free active form. More Hydrocortisone binds to the Glucocorticoid Receptor, intensifying its effects.

visuals: Visual representation of an amplified cellular response due to excessive NR3C1 activation (e.g., exaggerated gene expression, cellular overstimulation). Overlay text: 'Increased Steroid Effects', 'Risk of Toxicity'. Fade to a clear warning message or a 'Consult a Healthcare Professional' graphic.
narration: This heightened receptor activation amplifies steroid effects, increasing toxicity risk. Always consult a professional.
